name: RC Time Constant
explanation: The RC time constant (τ = RC) determines how quickly a capacitor charges or discharges through a resistor. After one time constant, a capacitor reaches 63.2% of final voltage when charging, or drops to 36.8% when discharging. After 5 time constants (5τ), the capacitor is considered fully charged or discharged (99.3%). This is fundamental for timing circuits, filters, and signal processing.

examples.problem: What is the time constant for a 10kΩ resistor and 100μF capacitor?
How long does it take a capacitor to fully charge (5 time constants)?

proof: τ = RC. Time for capacitor to charge to 63.2% (1 - 1/e) of final voltage. From differential equation: dV/dt = (V_s - V)/(RC). Solution: V(t) = V_s(1 - e^(-t/RC)). At t = τ = RC, V = V_s(1 - 1/e) ≈ 0.632V_s.
